update.description:
Per @nkoenig's request in [gazebo PR 1557](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1557/presetmanager-part-2-command-line-sdf/diff), I added an accessor to Element that returns a `boost::any`. It calls a new accessor in `Param` maps the `type_info` of the parameter to cast its `boost::variant` value to the right type.

I tried to figure out a fancier, shorter way to cast the `boost::variant` in Param to a `boost::any` but it didn't seem to work, so I went with this more verbose solution.
update.title: Added boost::any accessor for Param and Element

content.raw:
I think he wants you to match the logic in the following function in terms of what to do if the key is missing and error messages and so forth:

* #!/osrf/sdformat/src/boost_any/include/sdf/SDFImpl.hh#cl-252
content.html:
I think he wants you to match the logic in the following function in terms of what to do if the key is missing and error messages and so forth:

  • #!/osrf/sdformat/src/boost_any/include/sdf/SDFImpl.hh#cl-252

content.raw: I tried to make it const and it complains because I'm calling `Get`, which is not const. I could change the function so it doesn't call `Get` and make it const, or in an ABI-breaking PR that targets default I could make Get const.
content.html: I tried to make it const and it complains because I'm calling Get, which is not const. I could change the function so it doesn't call Get and make it const, or in an ABI-breaking PR that targets default I could make Get const.

content.raw:
[clang warning here](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/SDFormat/job/sdformat-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/8/warnings7Result/new/)
~~~
if statement has empty body
~~~
maybe needs parentheses?
~~~
else if (!(this->GetAttribute(_key)->GetAny(result)))
~~~
content.html:
clang warning here

if statement has empty body

maybe needs parentheses?

else if (!(this->GetAttribute(_key)->GetAny(result)))
